doc.field: Schroeder in favor of less bureaucracy for adoption of 630 DM law

Chancellor Schroeder once again ruled out changes to the reorganization of the 630 DM jobs. However, Schroeder said at the annual meeting of the National Association of German Newspaper Publishers in Berlin he would welcome talks about reducing bureaucracy for the adoption of the law. The chancellor admitted that the government's measures had gone too far with respect to the amendment on fictitious self-employment. The proposed change intends to exempt new business owners from paying social insurance contributions for a certain period of time. The same applies to older persons who had already gained entitlement. The vice-president of the newspaper publishers, Heinen, criticized the laws as doing away with jobs and being counterproductive.

The SPD leadership adheres to its plans on a capital levy. The designated general secretary, Muentefering, said after a presidency meeting in Berlin that he saw no reason for a change of plans. Large assets should pay their contributions to modernizing the state and to the consolidation of public authorities. Saxony's State Premier, Biedenkopf, voiced his criticism. The CDU politician said in a newspaper interview that a capital levy would create the impression that those well-off would not be welcome.
Biedenkopf ready for compromise in fight over savings measures

Saxony's State Premier, Biedenkopf, indicated readiness for a compromise in the fight over the savings package of the federal givernment. The CDU politican will not oppose the proposed two-year pension adjustment to the rate of inflation in the Bundesrat. Biedenkopf said in a newspaper interview that it was obvious that the government needed to spend less and to contract fewer debts.
Greens also to include CDU in pension talks

The Green party wants to include the CDU in the debatte concerning the future pension policy. The spokesperson of the board, Radcke, said that it was necessary to have as many majority partners in society as possible for a pension reform.
Expert commission demands extensive reform of the EU

An expert commission charged with reforming the union suggested quick and extensive steps. The former Prime Minister of Belgium, de Hane, said at the introduction of the report in Brussels that the decisions on the upcoming expansion of the EU should be taken before the end of the year 2000. The accession of Eastern European countries should not be delayed because of internal problems of the European Union. Former federal president von Weizsaecker and the former British trade minister Simon developed the reform package next to De Hane. It is intended to serve the EU commission as a basis for its debatte on the restructuring.
Forum Ost wants to increase support of East Germans' interests

The "Forum Ost" of the SPD wants to take a more critical issue with the politics of the federal government in the future, as indicated by the chairperson of the committee, Brandenburg's State Premier Stolpe, in an interview with the newspaper "Maerkische Oderzeitung". So far, the forum had voiced the demands of the East German population insufficiently. The people did no longer trust the SPD in East Germany to take their needs into consideration. For this reason, the Forum would more strongly voice questions such as matching salaries between East and West.
Fire in storage building in Rheinfelden

A fire in a storage building for aluminum waste in Rheinfelden caused damages worth several million German marks last night. Nobody was injured. Air measurements showed no release of dangerous substances. The fire brigade asked people living nearby to keep the windows and doors closed for the time being due to heavy smoke in the area. According to the police, an overheated machine may have caught fire and started the fire in the building which measures 120 by 35 meters. It burned down completely.
Talks on disqualification of Schumacher and Irvine on Friday

Ferrari's appeal on the disqualification in Malaysia will be heard on Friday. At that time, the FIA will decide whether the disqualification of Michael Schumacher and Eddy Irvine will be upheld. If it is upheld, the Finnish driver Micha Haekkinnen will become Formula I champion. Yesterday the race committee disallowed the first and second place by the Ferrari drivers because the wind deflectors of their cars were too long.

The moderator of the TV program "heute journal", von Lojewski, was awarded the Hans-Joachim-Friedrichs-Preis for television journalism in Cologne. In particular, the jury praised the vivid narrative language with which Lojewski reports the daily events. The promotional prize, which was given out for the second time, went to the ARD correspondent in Paris, Hassel.
